intro: Galium firmum var. euboeum, commonly known as Euboean bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and usually covered with fine hairs. Galium firmum var. euboeum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
